557409.name: Herbal Neck Wrap
557409.gauge_description: 30 stitches and 24 rows = 4 inches in Stocking Stitch
557409.notes_html:
Other Notions Needed:

3 to 4 inch sewable (not adhesive) Velcro strips or non-metal snap closures
sewing thread to match velcro
sewing needle
yarn darning needle
1 knee high stocking
2 (or 3) 1 lb. bags whole flax seeds (health food store)
favorite smelling herbal tea, dried herbs, and/or essential oils
large mixing bowl
plastic funnel or cardboard toiler pater or paper towel tube
measuring cup, scoop, or soup ladle

749589.name: Feminine pad
749589.notes_html:
A quick and easy washable pad / pantyliner pattern for a cost/environment friendly alternative to disposable pads.
Comes with option for an insert (for extra protection and easy washing).
Sizes available are - small, medium, and large. However, you will find it is very easy to adjust if needed!
749589.notes:

Comes with option for an insert (for extra protection and easy washing).

7335894.name: Retention Bandage (Machine)
7335894.notes_html:
THIS IS THE MACHINE-KNITTED PATTERN

Please use 100% cotton light fingering/ fingering weight yarn (CYC #1) for the machine-knitted version.

These cotton retention bandages may be used for medical conditions with chronic skin ulcers which need regular wound care. It can be washed and reused. It is an alternative to disposable store-bought bandages.

Please secure your doctor’s/health provider’s approval before using these bandages.

BACKGROUND

On April 4, 2024 I posted a request on Facebook and Instagram for help with this project. In truth, I had expected only a few to come forward. I never expected thousands of knitters and crocheters to offer their help.

I am very grateful for many, many kind individuals.

These cotton retention bandages are reusable bandages that are placed over the primary wound dressing. These are for our patients with Leprosy (Hansen’s disease) who have chronic, non-healing wounds. They are patients at the University of the Philippines-Philippine General Hospital (UP-PGH) Department of Dermatology.

OVERVIEW
Please be guided by the following:
-please use only 100% cotton or mercerized cotton, lace weight (CYC #0), 26-27 wraps per inch (WPI). These are bandages for medical use and must be thin.
-please DO NOT use any synthetic fiber (no acrylic, cotton blends, polyester, raylon, milk cotton, poly cotton, lanalon, indophil)
-undyed, bare, white, cream, natural, and off-white only (no color dyes which can potentially irritate open wounds )

THREAD
-for those who live in the Philippines – Monaco mercerized cotton 3-ply balls or cone, Cannon mercerized cotton 3-ply ball or cone, Monaco CCK83 mercerized cotton 3-ply cone
-for those who live in other countries – cotton crochet thread size 10. A list of suggested thread/yarn is included in the pattern. It will be updated as often as necessary. The updated list will also be posted in the Knits by May Facebook group under the Guides tab - Retention Bandages https://www.facebook.com/groups/knitsbymay/

-the gauge is not important. Please adjust the size of your knitting needles or crochet hook depending on your personal gauge/tension to produce the right fabric.

I have set up chat groups within a Facebook group for updates and to answer your questions. Joining the Knits by May Facebook group and the chat group is purely voluntary. The link to the group is https://www.facebook.com/groups/knitsbymay/ then join the chat for your location.

As of April 2024, there are two chats (PH and Worldwide). In the Worldwide chat there are side chats for US/Canada and Australia/New Zealand.

Many, many thanks to Ariett07 for converting the hand-knitting pattern into a machine-knitting pattern.

Thank you all for your generosity and willingness to share your time and your talent.

Dr. May

——

June 2024 update

  • includes option for 4-inch wide bandages
  • additional thread options
7335894.notes:
THIS IS THE MACHINE-KNITTED PATTERN

Please use 100% cotton light fingering/ fingering weight yarn (CYC #1) for the machine-knitted version.

These cotton retention bandages may be used for medical conditions with chronic skin ulcers which need regular wound care. It can be washed and reused. It is an alternative to disposable store-bought bandages.

Please secure your doctor’s/health provider’s approval before using these bandages.


------ 

BACKGROUND

On April 4, 2024 I posted a request on Facebook and Instagram for help with this project. In truth, I had expected only a few to come forward. I never expected thousands of knitters and crocheters to offer their help. 

I am very grateful for many, many kind individuals.

These cotton retention bandages are reusable bandages that are placed over the primary wound dressing. These are for our patients with Leprosy (Hansen’s disease) who have chronic, non-healing wounds. They are patients at the University of the Philippines-Philippine General Hospital (UP-PGH) Department of Dermatology.


OVERVIEW
Please be guided by the following:
-please use only 100% cotton or mercerized cotton, lace weight (CYC #0), 26-27 wraps per inch (WPI). These are bandages for medical use and must be thin.
-please DO NOT use any synthetic fiber (no acrylic, cotton blends, polyester, raylon, milk cotton, poly cotton, lanalon, indophil)
-undyed, bare, white, cream, natural, and off-white only (no color dyes which can potentially irritate open wounds )

THREAD
-for those who live in the Philippines – Monaco mercerized cotton 3-ply balls or cone, Cannon mercerized cotton 3-ply ball or cone, Monaco CCK83 mercerized cotton 3-ply cone 
-for those who live in other countries – cotton crochet thread size 10. A list of suggested thread/yarn is included in the pattern. It will be updated as often as necessary. The updated list will also be posted in the Knits by May Facebook group under the Guides tab - Retention Bandages https://www.facebook.com/groups/knitsbymay/ 

-the gauge is not important. Please adjust the size of your knitting needles or crochet hook depending on your personal gauge/tension to produce the right fabric.


I have set up chat groups within a Facebook group for updates and to answer your questions. Joining the Knits by May Facebook group and the chat group is purely voluntary. The link to the group is https://www.facebook.com/groups/knitsbymay/ then join the chat for your location. 

As of April 2024, there are two chats (PH and Worldwide). In the Worldwide chat there are side chats for US/Canada and Australia/New Zealand. 

Many, many thanks to **Ariett07** for converting the hand-knitting pattern into a machine-knitting pattern.

Thank you all for your generosity and willingness to share your time and your talent.


Dr. May 

—— 

June 2024 update
- includes option for 4-inch wide bandages
- additional thread options

7361771.name: Diva Menstrual Cup
7361771.notes_html:
I am using chenille yarn by different manufacturers in size 6 bulky. I use it with a 5mm crochet hook. In this project I use safety eyes in 14mm. Of course you can use any yarn and a matching hook and eyes.
If you use my recommendations, your Diva will be around 10 cm tall, and 8 cm wide.

Ich nutze Chenille Wolle von verschiedenen Herstellern, meist in Garndicke 6 Bulky. Dazu nutze ich eine 5mm Häkelnadel. In diesem Projekt nutze ich Sicherheitsaugen in Größe 12mm.. Ihr könnt natürlich jede Wolle und die jeweils passende Nadel und Augen dafür nutzen.
Mit meinen Empfehlungen wird der Körper etwa 8 cm breit und 10 cm lang.
7361771.notes:
I am using chenille yarn by different manufacturers in size 6 bulky. I use it with a 5mm crochet hook. In this project I use safety eyes in 14mm. Of course you can use any yarn and a matching hook and eyes.
If you use my recommendations, your Diva will be around 10 cm tall, and 8 cm wide.



Ich nutze Chenille Wolle von verschiedenen Herstellern, meist in Garndicke 6 Bulky. Dazu nutze ich eine 5mm Häkelnadel. In diesem Projekt nutze ich Sicherheitsaugen in Größe 12mm.. Ihr könnt natürlich jede Wolle und die jeweils passende Nadel und Augen dafür nutzen.
Mit meinen Empfehlungen wird der Körper etwa 8 cm breit und 10 cm lang.

7377520.name: Disabled Parking Badge Holder
7377520.notes_html:
The holder is to keep a disability badge and timer disc safe.
Quick and easy to make using knit stitches throughout.
Easily adjusted for larger badges by adding extra stitches and rows.

7401938.name: Taste Bud Model
7401938.notes_html: Pattern good for advanced beginners. 7 different colors of worsted weight yarn. G and H hooks. Dc, sc, hdc, inc and dec as well as working in the round needed. 3D anatomy of a taste bud model.

7403132.name: Customizable Wheelchair Blanket
7403132.notes_html:
This wheelchair blanket pattern is a simple design for an advanced beginner crocheter.

Straps with button closer to attach blanket to the wheelchair and prevent sliding and falling off.

A lap pocket to warm hands or store small items.

Pattern Features:
⏺️ Low-vision font selection
⏺️ High contrast colors
⏺️ Large, easy-to-read print
⏺️ Large, color photographs for design details
⏺️ Tips to make a beautiful, functional, customized creation.

pattern_author.name: Davana
pattern_author.notes:
Distracted by shiny objects, hurtling from one interest to another, on and on, and then back again.

You will find me reading journal articles about herbal lung health, weeping over politics, crocheting and knitting furiously, binging on random shows, writing fiction, blogging, instagramming, or falling down the internet rabbit hole.

Tarot, crystals, astrology, personality research, numerology, and meditation have grown and are growing into a large part of my life. I believe firmly in energies humans just haven’t discovered or figured out yet.

Join me…

7408532.name: Walker Organizer
7408532.gauge_description: 10 stitches and 20 rows = 4 inches in Thermal Stitch, double stranded
7408532.notes_html:
Do you know someone that uses a walker to aid in their mobility? Perhaps they could use a walker organizer to hold their phone, eyeglasses, tissues, pens, remotes, and other miscellaneous items.

Customize the pockets just for them with this easy to follow, sturdy, and clever crochet pattern.

This is the second pattern in the 2025 Donation Crochet Series: https://hearthookhome.com/tag/2025-donation-crochet-series/
7408532.notes:

This is the second pattern in the 2025 Donation Crochet Series: https://hearthookhome.com/tag/2025-donation-crochet-series/

pattern_author.name: Ashlea Schumaker
pattern_author.notes:
Ashlea is the crochet blogger and yarn lover behind HeartHookHome.com.

With a passion for detailed crochet tutorials and easy-to-follow patterns, you'll be right at home as a beginner crocheter or an experienced hooker. I love to design patterns that are useful and garments that are size-inclusive. All of my patterns are well-tested in multiple sizes.

Here you will find a collection of ad-free printable versions of Heart Hook Home patterns, many of which you can also find for free on my blog. 

Here is the crochet pattern page: https://hearthookhome.com/category/crochet/crochet-pattern/

I frequently share promotions on social media, and I’d love to get better acquainted!

Get on my email newsletter list here: https://heart-hook-home.ck.page/ea8a2c67c1

Get 15% off any purchase $15.00 or more with code **SAVE15**
Get 20% off any purchase $20.00 or more with code **SAVE20**
Buy 5 or more patterns and get 25% off with code **BUY5GET25**

7408792.name: Asthma Inhaler Purse
7408792.notes_html:
A small purse to hold an asthma inhaler which keep it safe and also handy for use. Made for standard size inhalers. Add or decrease the amount of stitches in multiple of three to make it larger or smaller.
The pattern is knitted using knit and purl stitches and a simple four row pattern.
7408792.notes:
A small purse to hold an asthma inhaler which keep it safe and also handy for use.  Made for standard size inhalers. Add or decrease the amount of stitches in multiple of three to make it larger or smaller.
The pattern is knitted using knit and purl stitches and a simple four row pattern.

7417018.name: Awesome Breastform - Knit
7417018.sizes_available: Cup sizes A, B, C, D, DD and E
7417018.notes_html:
An Awesome Breastform is a cottom breast prosthetic designed to be worn inside the wearer’s bra. The form is knit in one piece. The back of the form is indented so that it stands away from the chest wall and doesn’t irritate the wearer’s scar. A slit and flap is knit into the form so that the wearer can remove or insert additional stuffing.

The pattern was previously exclusively available for approved Awesome Breastforms volunteers. It is now available to the public, Awesome Breastforms requests that this pattern be used solely for personal or charitable purposes and not for retail or commercial purposes.

Awesome Breastforms is not able to provide pattern support.

Sizes: A (B, C, D, DD, E). See pattern for explanation regarding sizes.

Awesome Breastforms recommends using 100% cotton yarn. A list of recommended yarns is included in the pattern.
7417018.notes:
An Awesome Breastform is a cottom breast prosthetic designed to be worn inside the wearer's bra. The form is knit in one piece. The back of the form is indented so that it stands away from the chest wall and doesn't irritate the wearer's scar. A slit and flap is knit into the form so that the wearer can remove or insert additional stuffing.

The pattern was previously exclusively available for approved Awesome Breastforms volunteers. It is now available to the public, Awesome Breastforms requests that this pattern be used solely for personal or charitable purposes and not for retail or commercial purposes.

Sizes: A (B, C, D, DD, E). See pattern for explanation regarding sizes.

Awesome Breastforms recommends using 100% cotton yarn. A list of recommended yarns is included in the pattern.

7420815.name: Coastal Granny at a Rave
7420815.sizes_available: One size 58” at border, 46” each side.
7420815.notes_html:
Yarn: MC - Stellina Sock by CMS (75% Superwash merino, 20% nylon, 5% gold stellina) - 560 yds
CC - Fingering/Sock by Yarn Matters (85% fine merino superwash, 15% nylon) in Tempting Splash - 300 yds

Notions
US 4 24” or longer circular needles
2 stitch markers
scissors

This shawl was designed as a sibling to crochet design Granny at a Rave by Connie Lee Lynch for Dogwood Fber Trail - a fun fiber event in Virginia (April 4-12, 2025).

The design features airy texture, 2” contrasting border, and seed stitch sides.. Three tassels (optional).

Very simple 4 sts 4 rows repeats that are easy to memorize.
7420815.notes:

Notions

scissors 

This shawl was designed as a sibling to crochet design Granny at a Rave by Connie Lee Lynch for Dogwood Fber Trail - a fun fiber event in Virginia (April 4-12, 2025).

pattern_author.name: Marina Hayes
pattern_author.notes:
I was born and raised in Ural Mountains of Russia where I learned to knit as a child. I started to write down my improvisations after numerous requests for my patterns on Ravelry.

I am the owner of yarn shop in Williamsburg, VA, YARN MATTERS. Stop by the shop!

www.yarnmatters.com
https://www.facebook.com/YarnMatters/
pattern_author.notes_html:
I was born and raised in Ural Mountains of Russia where I learned to knit as a child. I started to write down my improvisations after numerous requests for my patterns on Ravelry.

I am the owner of yarn shop in Williamsburg, VA, YARN MATTERS. Stop by the shop!

www.yarnmatters.com
https://www.facebook.com/YarnMatters/

users.about_me:
Hello, I was born and raised in Russia, learned how to knit, crochet, and sew  at a very young age. I am also a musician - I have a degree in Cello Performance. 

In 2016 I started my own business - a local yarn shop in Williamsburg, VA. 

We hope you will enjoy our handpicked selection of beautiful yarns, tools, accessories, and patterns. We are also planning to have knitting and crocheting classes, knitting groups, workshops, trunk shows, and other cool and fun stuff.

To see our progress please visit our groups on [Ravelry][1], [Facebook][2] (please like us), and our [website][3]. We also expanded to [Etsy][4] .

​Please let us know, what you would like to see at the new shop. We would like to hear from our future customers! Suggestions and comments are encouraged! 

Yarn Matters is located at 7437 Richmond Rd, Williamsburg, VA. It is a few miles from Colonial Williamsburg, very close to I-64 Exit 231A.


  [1]: http://www.ravelry.com/groups/yarn-matters
  [2]: https://www.facebook.com/YarnMatters/
  [3]: www.yarnmatters.com
  [4]: http://www.etsy.com/shop/YarnMattersShop
